results.title: Basic chemistry: family of halogens
results.brief_description: Shows the similarity and graduation of properties of the halogens and explains both the similarities and differences in degree on the basis of atomic structure. Looks at the properties of other families of elements in the Periodic Table. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Bashful ballerina
results.brief_description: Imogene Coca is delightful as Miss Klutz, a pupil in the dance troupe of a Russian artiste named Kobelev. Miss Klutz is so clumsy - no matter how hard she tries to be a good dancer, her performances are always a disaster When a rival calls upon Kobelev to lend her ballet troupe a dancer, Miss Klutz gets the job…and the laughs that go with it. Cast also includes Eugene Sigaloff, Irene Moore, George Lessey, Alexander Asro, Alyce Chappelle, Buddy Page.

results.title: Based on Deception
results.creator_credit: Brian R. Everett and British Information Services
results.brief_description: An account of a British surveying expedition working at Deception Base in Antarctica. Shows the departure from London of the thirty-three people involved in the team, their arrival, life and work at Deception.

results.title: Barra the new sonobuoy
results.brief_description: A new development in anti-submarine sensors, the sonobuoy, is dropped from anti-submarine aircraft and automatically anchored. Its range and accuracy is extremely good and the Barra sonobuoy is manufactured entirely in Australia. No other credits available.

results.title: Bargemen on the Rhine
results.brief_description: Shows how barges move along the Rhine carrying goods and produce. Details the operation and servicing and life aboard a modern tug. Suitable for upper primary and secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Barefoot student army
results.creator_credit: Catherine Marciniak, John Moore, Lyndal Barry, Open Channel Productions and Sophie Barry
results.brief_description: In March 1988, Burmese students took to the streets in the capital Rangoon as a protest against the oppressive rule of Prime Minister Ne Win. Ten thousand protesters were killed in what was perceived to be a typical response by Government forces. Many students, fighting for survival, fled into the jungle in order to find freedom. Sophie and Lyndall Barry, two young Melbourne film makers, intended to stay only a matter of days, but remained for a year recording the plight of these students on the Thai/Burma border. A compelling documentary providing insight into one of the politically sensitive regions of Asia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Catherine Marciniak, John Moore, Lyndal Barry, Open Channel Productions and Sophie Barry

results.title: Banking in the Next Two Decades
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
An expert in the field discusses the impact of computers on banking in the next two decades, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne (October 16-18,1980)

results.title: Banjo's Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Banjo’s Australia explains A.B. Paterson’s contribution to Australian literature from the 1890’s to World War 1. It traces Paterson’s personal history, his love of the bush, his admiration for camaraderie, and the pathos and humour of bush life.

results.title: Banaras: the holy city
results.creator_credit: K Khandpur, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Presents various facets of life in the ageless city of Banaras, also known as Varanasi or Benares. The origin of the city is not known. It has been a Hindu sacred city, the home of Shiva, Lord of the Universe, for centuries. Includes prayers and chants, ceremonies and acts of devotions in temples and on the holy river bank; traditional Hindu schools; the 200 year-old observatory, centre of astrology; Sanskrit education at the University of Banaras; traditions and cottage industries; the nearby shrine where Buddha preached his first sermon; Buddhist devotions around it.
